content.en: Parkinson's treatment optimization: Researchers have been investigating the effects of different treatments and algorithms on Parkinson's disease. Levodopa has been found to eliminate beta oscillations, while deep brain stimulation decreases them. Adaptive deep brain stimulation, which tracks changes in levodopa and deep brain stimulation-induced spectral power, shows promise in improving the treatment of movement disorders. Closed-loop deep brain stimulation based on beta oscillations reduces rigidity but does not improve bradykinesia. These findings highlight the potential of algorithms in optimizing treatment outcomes for Parkinson's disease.
content.da: Optimering af Parkinsons behandling: Forskere har undersøgt effekterne af forskellige behandlinger og algoritmer på Parkinsons sygdom. Levodopa har vist sig at eliminere beta-oscillationer, mens deep brain stimulation reducerer dem. Adaptiv deep brain stimulation, som sporer ændringer i levodopa og deep brain stimulation-induceret spektral power, viser lovende resultater i forbedringen af behandlingen af bevægelsesforstyrrelser. Closed-loop deep brain stimulation baseret på beta-oscillationer reducerer stivhed, men forbedrer ikke bradykinesi. Disse fund fremhæver potentialet for algoritmer i optimeringen af behandlingsresultater for Parkinsons sygdom.
